intro: Eria brachybotrya, commonly known as the short-stemmed orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid environments. The plant features a short, thick rhizome with numerous roots and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow.
